intro: Tricostularia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian tricostularia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with three lobes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
